content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```Julia
using Markdown

function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia.*?```", md, seed=1))
    
    code_blocks = [join([split(strip(block.match[3:end-3]), "\n")[2:end]...] , "\n") for block in blocks]
    
    return join(code_blocks)
end
```
This function works by using regular expressions to identify the code blocks, then strips away the fences and joins everything together with a newline. Note that `split(str, "\n")` is used to remove leading/trailing whitespaces from each line of the block (if any). The second argument [2:end] in split is used to skip the first line which contains ```julia or ```sh
Finally join all the blocks together with a newline.
